name: James B. NORTON, III, Alan M. Wolfe and James J. Marlowe, v. William T. GLENN, Sr. Troy Publishing Company Inc., Tom Kennedy, and William M. Caulfield, Petition of Troy Publishing Company, Inc., Tom Kennedy and William Caulfield

parties: James B. NORTON, III, Alan M. Wolfe and James J. Marlowe, v. William T. GLENN, Sr. Troy Publishing Company Inc., Tom Kennedy, and William M. Caulfield, Petition of Troy Publishing Company, Inc., Tom Kennedy and William Caulfield.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 29th day of January, 2003, the Petitions for Allowance of Appeal are GRANTED, but LIMITED to the following issue:
Whether the constitutional privilege of neutral reportage is viable in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
815 A.2d 1040
James B. NORTON, III, Alan M. Wolfe and James J. Marlowe, v. William T. GLENN, Sr. Troy Publishing Company Inc., Tom Kennedy, and William M. Caulfield, Petition of Troy Publishing Company, Inc., Tom Kennedy and William Caulfield.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Jan. 29, 2003.
